<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Poultice Preparation](/Feats.aspx?ID=1984) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 176 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Herbalist](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=62)

**Prerequisites**
[Herbalist Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=1982)

</column>

---

When you create an herbal elixir, you can prepare it as a poultice instead. A poultice gains the [oil](/Traits.aspx?ID=121) trait (but remains alchemical, not magical) and loses the [elixir](/Traits.aspx?ID=59) and [ingested](/Traits.aspx?ID=95) traits. You can apply a poultice by Interacting with one hand. When you apply a poultice, in addition to the item's normal effects, the recipient can attempt an immediate flat check to recover from a single source of [persistent acid, bleed, or fire damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29), with the DC reduction from appropriate assistance.
name: Poultice Preparation
